FileFormat.FormatDescription: A file containing Java bytecode that can be executed on the Java virtual machine (JVM). A Java class file is usually generated by a Java compiler from a Java programming language source code file. Java is a high-level, class-based, object-oriented general-purpose programming language designed to have as few implementation dependencies as possible.
FileFormat.ProvenanceName: Digital Preservation Department / The National Archives
FileFormat.ProvenanceDescription: Description was submitted by Stadtarchiv Hof (Municipal Archives of Hof, Free State of Bavaria, Germany) in v112 of PRONOM signature file.

InternalSignature.SignatureNote: Magic number (first four bytes) of every valid class file is 0xCAFEBABE
